newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy minister says bank reform draft due soon.
newsitem.headline: Italy minister says bank reform draft due soon.

text.p: A government draft project to reform the banking sector may be ready as early as next week, Labour Minister Tiziano Treu said on Thursday.
The government and the Italian banking association have been involved in talks on how to carry out the reform.

Prime Minister Romano Prodi's office said last month that Italian banks faced a critical situation in terms of efficiency and urgent measures were needed to bring the system in line with other European countries.

Bank of Italy governor Antonio Fazio has already warned of the Banking system's low profitability and its need for restructuring, urging Italy's some 1,000 Banking groups to cut their estimated 300,000 workforce by at least 10 percent.
Treu said the government would be offering a "general framework" for change but that the sector would have to resolve problems of individual banks.
The government has been consulting trades unions for their views. -- Rome newsroom +392 66129589
